conclusion: To determine the relationship between the electric power P consumed by the circuit and 15 W, analyze the circuit in both open and closed switch scenarios.
The circuit consists of resistance R1 and an ammeter when the switch is open.
Using Ohm's Law, V = I0 x R1 = 0.5 A x 20 Ω = 10 V.
When the switch is closed, the circuit includes R1 and the motor with internal resistance R2.
The total resistance in the circuit is R_total = R1 + R2 = 30 Ω.
The voltage across the circuit remains unchanged at 10 V. Calculate current I = V / R_total = 10 V / 30 Ω = 1/3 A.
Calculate the power P consumed by the circuit: P = V x I = 10 V x 1/3 A = 10/3 W ≈ 3.33 W.
The power consumed by the circuit when the switch is closed is approximately 3.33 W, which is less than 15 W.
The electric power P consumed by the circuit is less than 15 W.
